item.title: Report E-2024100364
item.description:
Report E-2024100364

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-17T09:14:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-04
  • City: SANGER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 4, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon jug of UN1789 was damaged during loading and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized soda ash and absorbents to remediate the site. All waste was containerized in one (1) 30-gallon drum and one (1) 15-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100312
item.description:
Report E-2024100312

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-12T21:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-19
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 9:40 AM ET, Paul Harper with LHO (new terminal) contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Houston, TX. The spill consists of approximately 30 gallons of Unisol Liquid Red B-75, which released from (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture. Contractors deployed absorbents into the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents, pads, PPE and pallet were collected and containerized into (4) 55-gallon metal drums. The damaged drum was placed into (1) 95-gallon metal overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024100298
item.description:
Report E-2024100298

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-11T09:22:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-18
  • City: LUBBOCK
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 9:48 AM ET, LLB contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred on the dock in Lubbock, TX. The spill consists of approximately 6 ounces of Liquid Fury 270, which released from a 55-gallon poly drum due to a small pinhole at the bottom of the drum that was caused during dock operations. The contractors overpacked the drum into (1) 85-gallon metal drum and staged the waste for terminal personnel to manage.
